channel.title: "I caught my Dad with my GF!"
channel.description:
[quote] I've had my GF for 2 years now (practically lives with me) - small white, petite thang, cooks for me, always been good to me.
I go away on holiday for a week, come back and something just doesn't seem right. I asked my Father if he had seen anything happen with my GF and he acts clueless.
So fast forward to 3 weeks later... I'm coming home from work when BAM clear as day, right in my Kitchen I catch my Father red handed with his meat in my GF.
I was lalalalaed, told him to get his meat out of GF and lalalala, needless to say my GF got turned off. I just couldn't get over it and that night kicked my GF to the curb.
Now it's been 2 weeks since the incident and that I've been without my GF and about 10 minutes ago my Father had the audacity to ask my how my GF has been, when he's the damn reason we ain't together no more.
Should I get off the computer and start swinging at him?
OR
Pack my stuff and be on my way.
Here's pics of my GF for you guys as I know you'll ask. [url]https://blogs.cisco.com/news_img/geor...an%20grill.jpg[/url] [/quote] :fffuuu: Saw this on another forum.
GF means George foreman grill. Not Girlfriend. :stuck_out_tongue:

item.title: "I caught my Dad with my GF!"
item.dc:creator: Kaze
item.description:
shifty:

The story itself fails. Why the hell would u kick out ur grill just cause ur dad has his meat in it? U could always wash it out. If the story definitely makes it should like the grill was a human. The story would have succeed if it was on an equilibrium where we don’t know if its a grill or a girl friend. But this story made it sound more like a grill so therefore it fails and furthermore it is also not welcome on this forum or even on the Internets.

:what:

Read full topic
item.source: "I caught my Dad with my GF!"
